artist: Author: Jalaluddin Mohammad Rumi; Translator: Zahra Partovi; Joan Busing; Sandy Gellis; Elizabeth Harrington; Bernard Kirschenbaum; Ted Kurahara; James Nares; Dorothea Rockburne; Betye Saar; Annette Senneby; Michelle Stuart; Peter Thomson; Judith Turner; Marjorie VanDyke; Joan Vennum; Susan Weil; Publisher: Vincent FitzGerald & Company, New York
image_copyright: © 1996 Vincent FitzGerald & Company, New York, publisher
life_date: Jalaluddin Mohammad Rumi, Author, Persian, 1207–1273; Zahra Partovi, Translator, Iranian, born 1944; Joan Busing, American, 20th century; Sandy Gellis, American, born 1940; Elizabeth Harrington, American (born South Africa), born 1935; Bernard Kirschenbaum, American, 1924–2016; Ted Kurahara, American, born 1925; James Nares, British, born 1953; Dorothea Rockburne, American (born Canada), born 1932; Betye Saar, American, born 1926; Annette Senneby, Swedish, born 1951; Michelle Stuart, American, born 1938; Peter Thomson, American, 20th century; Judith Turner, American, born 1939; Marjorie VanDyke, American, born 1956; Joan Vennum, American, born 1930; Susan Weil, American, born 1930; Vincent FitzGerald & Company, New York, Publisher
medium: Lithography, etching, photogravure, screenprinting, plotter drawing, collage, and letterpress, bound volume
provenance: William P. Kosmas, London, England (d. 2017); Estate of William P. Kosmas, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: Signed in pencil by the translator Zahra Partovi and each of the 15 artists
title: Divan e Shams
